intro: Gomphostemma rugosum, commonly known as rough-stemmed gomphostemma, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in the understory of forests. Gomphostemma rugosum is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
